context: The penthouse. The top. Private elevator, city view, everything you dreamed of. Maya visits.

lines.text: The elevator opens directly into your apartment. There's a chandelier.
Floor-to-ceiling windows. Every district visible — downtown's neon, the harbor's fog, the industrial glow, the hillside curves winding up into darkness.
The private garage elevator can hold eight cars. Eight. The number feels obscene and perfect.
You pour a drink and stand at the window. The city hums sixty stories below. Every road, every alley — yours.
A knock at the door. No — the elevator chimes.
She walks to the window. Presses her hand against the glass. The city reflects in her eyes.

lines.speaker: maya
lines.text: You can see Torres Auto from here. That little dot with the yellow sign.
Something in her voice. Not jealousy. Not quite sadness. Something she hasn't named yet.

lines.speaker: maya
lines.text: Just... don't get lost up here. It's a long way down.
She stays for an hour. You talk about cars. It almost feels like the couch days.
